comments.author: franky1
comments.body: SCAMthe scam is simple.set up 3 websites. call them all official.next step is to be vague about the offering until you hand them funds/identity. thats the 'hook' because once you hand them something, they have you. you are less likely to escape.this is a known business strategy. if they have your name email and know something about you. you are more likely to be interested in reading more about them/buy something from them.also they sell your info. knowing that even if your not a complete idiot to invest yet. just by handing info means your a potential idiot that can potentially fall for scams. and scammers like these types of people so will share this database of idiot lists.next step is to offer you a dream return on a small amount as their fake way of proving they make you profit. this is the next 'hook' to stab and pull you in. because once you have invested something small, you are more likely to invest more. when they eventually steal your main excessive funds the other 2 sites say THEIR 3rd site is not theirs and not their fault. making you lose funds with no recourse. making you the person at fault by blaming you for using a site that is shady(even if they all are)and trying to prove they are linked and try to get returns via a court claim, is costly. which is why most scammers try to avoid scamming for more than $10k per victim. because if its less than $10k but a court case would cost more then $10k most victims dont bother taking things to court. and thats their strategy
